meanings.definition: A check issued to an employee in payment for work done.
meanings.sent1: Every Friday, the employees eagerly awaited their paychecks.
meanings.sent2: She used her paycheck to pay for groceries and rent.
meanings.sent3: The paycheck was like a little gift from the boss each month.
meanings.sent4: The paycheck was a symbol of hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The crisp paycheck felt like a reward for all the hours put in at the office.

meanings.definition: To give money in exchange for goods or services.
meanings.sent1: He paychecks his landlord every month for the rent.
meanings.sent2: They paycheck the workers at the end of each week.
meanings.sent3: She decided to paycheck the cashier with exact change.
meanings.sent4: The company will paycheck the suppliers for the materials delivered.
meanings.sent5: The customer will paycheck the store for the new furniture.
